tags.name: Archive
tags.description: Archive includes all deleted messages. Once messages are old enough then these are permanenetly deleted from the archive as well. Until then you can restore the deleted messages.

tags.name: Audit
tags.description: Auditing allows to monitor an email account. All existing, deleted and new emails are copied to the auditing system. See also https://github.com/nodemailer/wildduck-audit-manager

tags.name: Certs
tags.description: WildDuck allows to register TLS certificates to be used with SNI connections. These certificates are used by IMAP, POP3, API and SMTP servers when a SNI capable client establishes a TLS connection. This does not apply for MX servers.

tags.name: DKIM
tags.description: Whenever an email is sent WildDuck checks if there is a DKIM key registered for the domain name of the sender address and uses it to sign the message.

tags.name: DomainAccess
tags.description: Add sender domain names to allowlist (messages are all accepted) or blocklist (messages are sent to Spam folder)

tags.name: Storage
tags.description: Storage allows easier attachment handling when composing Draft messages. Instead of uploading the attachmnent with every draft update, you store the attachment to the Storage and then link stored file for the Draft.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Partial match of username or default email address

parameters.name: forward
parameters.description: Partial match of a forward email address or URL

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Comma separated list of tags. The User must have at least one to be set

parameters.name: requiredTags
parameters.description: Comma separated list of tags. The User must have all listed tags to be set

parameters.name: metaData
parameters.description: If true, then includes metaData in the response

parameters.name: internalData
parameters.description: If true, then includes internalData in the response. Not shown for user-role tokens.

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Cursor value for next page, retrieved from nextCursor response value

parameters.name: previous
parameters.description: Cursor value for previous page, retrieved from previousCursor response value

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Current page number. Informational only, page numbers start from 1

page.description: Current page number. Derived from page query argument

previousCursor.description: Either a cursor string or false if there are not any previous results

nextCursor.description: Either a cursor string or false if there are not any next results

query.description: Partial match of username or default email address

username.description: Username of the User. Dots are allowed but informational only ("user.name" is the same as "username").

password.description: Password for the account. Set to boolean false to disable password usage for the master scope, Application Specific Passwords would still be allowed

hashedPassword.description: If true then password is already hashed, so store as is. Supported hashes: pbkdf2, bcrypt ($2a, $2y, $2b), md5 ($1), sha512 ($6), sha256 ($5), argon2 ($argon2d, $argon2i, $argon2id). Stored hashes are rehashed to pbkdf2 on first successful password check.

allowUnsafe.description: If false then validates provided passwords against Have I Been Pwned API. Experimental, so validation is disabled by default but will be enabled automatically in some future version of WildDuck.

address.description: Default email address for the User (autogenerated if not set)

emptyAddress.description: If true then do not autogenerate missing email address for the User. Only needed if you want to create a user account that does not have any email address associated

retention.description: Default retention time (in ms). Set to 0 to disable

targets.description: An array of forwarding targets. The value could either be an email address or a relay url to next MX server ("smtp://mx2.zone.eu:25") or an URL where mail contents are POSTed to

spamLevel.description: Relative scale for detecting spam. 0 means that everything is spam, 100 means that nothing is spam

quota.description: Allowed quota of the user in bytes

recipients.description: How many messages per 24 hour can be sent

forwards.description: How many messages per 24 hour can be forwarded

filters.description: How many filters are allowed for this account

requirePasswordChange.description: If true then requires the user to change password, useful if password for the account was autogenerated

imapMaxUpload.description: How many bytes can be uploaded via IMAP during 24 hour

imapMaxDownload.description: How many bytes can be downloaded via IMAP during 24 hour

pop3MaxDownload.description: How many bytes can be downloaded via POP3 during 24 hour

pop3MaxMessages.description: How many latest messages to list in POP3 session

imapMaxConnections.description: How many parallel IMAP connections are alowed

receivedMax.description: How many messages can be received from MX during 60 seconds

fromWhitelist.description: A list of additional email addresses this user can send mail from. Wildcard is allowed.

tags.description: A list of tags associated with this user

addTagsToAddress.description: If true then autogenerated address gets the same tags as the user

uploadSentMessages.description: If true then all messages sent through MSA are also uploaded to the Sent Mail folder. Might cause duplicates with some email clients, so disabled by default.

disabledScopes.description: List of scopes that are disabled for this user ("imap", "pop3", "smtp")

metaData.description: Optional metadata, must be an object or JSON formatted string

internalData.description: Optional metadata for internal use, must be an object or JSON formatted string of an object. Not available for user-role tokens

pubKey.description: Public PGP key for the User that is used for encryption. Use empty string to remove the key

encryptMessages.description: If true then received messages are encrypted

encryptForwarded.description: If true then forwarded messages are encrypted

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Username of the User. Alphanumeric value. Must start with a letter, dots are allowed but informational only ("user.name" is the same as "username")

address.description: Main email address of the User

retention.description: Default retention time (in ms). false if not enabled

autoreply.description: Is autoreply enabled or not (start time may still be in the future or end time in the past)

encryptMessages.description: If true then received messages are encrypted

encryptForwarded.description: If true then forwarded messages are encrypted

pubKey.description: Public PGP key for the User that is used for encryption

metaData.description: Custom metadata object set for this user

internalData.description: Custom internal metadata object set for this user. Not available for user-role tokens

spamLevel.description: Relative scale for detecting spam. 0 means that everything is spam, 100 means that nothing is spam

tags.description: List of tags associated with the User

fromWhitelist.description: A list of additional email addresses this user can send mail from. Wildcard is allowed.

hasPasswordSet.description: If true then the User has a password set and can authenticate

disabled.description: If true then the user can not authenticate or receive any new mail

suspended.description: If true then the user can not authenticate

existingPassword.description: If provided then validates against account password before applying any changes

password.description: New password for the account. Set to boolean false to disable password usage for the master scope, Application Specific Passwords would still be allowed

hashedPassword.description: If true then password is already hashed, so store as is. Supported hashes: pbkdf2, bcrypt ($2a, $2y, $2b), md5 ($1), sha512 ($6), sha256 ($5), argon2 ($argon2d, $argon2i, $argon2id). Stored hashes are rehashed to pbkdf2 on first successful password check.

allowUnsafe.description: If false then validates provided passwords against Have I Been Pwned API. Experimental, so validation is disabled by default but will be enabled automatically in some future version of WildDuck.

targets.description: An array of forwarding targets. The value could either be an email address or a relay url to next MX server ("smtp://mx2.zone.eu:25") or an URL where mail contents are POSTed to

spamLevel.description: Relative scale for detecting spam. 0 means that everything is spam, 100 means that nothing is spam

uploadSentMessages.description: If true then all messages sent through MSA are also uploaded to the Sent Mail folder. Might cause duplicates with some email clients, so disabled by default.

fromWhitelist.description: A list of additional email addresses this user can send mail from. Wildcard is allowed.

metaData.description: Optional metadata, must be an object or JSON formatted string

internalData.description: Optional internal metadata, must be an object or JSON formatted string of an object. Not available for user-role tokens

pubKey.description: Public PGP key for the User that is used for encryption. Use empty string to remove the key

encryptMessages.description: If true then received messages are encrypted

encryptForwarded.description: If true then forwarded messages are encrypted

retention.description: Default retention time (in ms). Set to 0 to disable

quota.description: Allowed quota of the user in bytes

recipients.description: How many messages per 24 hour can be sent

forwards.description: How many messages per 24 hour can be forwarded

filters.description: How many filters are allowed for this account

imapMaxUpload.description: How many bytes can be uploaded via IMAP during 24 hour

imapMaxDownload.description: How many bytes can be downloaded via IMAP during 24 hour

pop3MaxDownload.description: How many bytes can be downloaded via POP3 during 24 hour

pop3MaxMessages.description: How many latest messages to list in POP3 session

imapMaxConnections.description: How many parallel IMAP connections are alowed

receivedMax.description: How many messages can be received from MX during 60 seconds

disable2fa.description: If true, then disables 2FA for this user

tags.description: A list of tags associated with this user

disabledScopes.description: List of scopes that are disabled for this user ("imap", "pop3", "smtp")

disabled.description: If true then disables user account (can not login, can not receive messages)

delete.description: This method deletes user and address entries from DB and schedules a background task to delete messages. You can call this method several times even if the user has already been deleted, in case there are still some pending messages.

parameters.name: deleteAfter
parameters.description: Delete user entry from registry but keep all user data until provided date. User account is fully recoverable up to that date.

reason.description: Message to be shown to connected IMAP client

post.description: This method recalculates quota usage for a User. Normally not needed, only use it if quota numbers are way off. This method is not transactional, so if the user is currently receiving new messages then the resulting value is not exact.

storageUsed.description: Calculated quota usage for the user

post.description: This method recalculates quota usage for all Users. Normally not needed, only use it if quota numbers are way off. This method is not transactional, so if the user is currently receiving new messages then the resulting value is not exact.

Export data for matching users. Export dump does not include emails, only account structure (user data, password hashes, mailboxes, filters, etc.). A special "export"-role access token is required for exporting and importing.

users.description: An array of User ID values to export

tags.description: An array of user tags to export. If set then at least one tag must exist on an user.

post.description: Import data from an export dump. If a database entry already exists, it is not modified. A special "export"-role access token is required for exporting and importing.

entries.description: How many database entries were found from the export file

imported.description: How many database entries were imported from the export file

failed.description: How many database entries were not imported due to some error

existing.description: How many database existing entries were not imported

post.description: This method generates a new temporary password for a User. Additionally it removes all two-factor authentication settings

validAfter.description: Allow using the generated password not earlier than provided time
The date password is valid after

get.summary: Return recovery info for a deleted user

storageUsed.description: Calculated quota usage for the user

tags.description: List of tags associated with the User

deleted.description: Datestring of the time the user was deleted

recoverableAddresses.description: List of email addresses that can be restored

post.description: Use this endpoint to cancel a timed deletion task scheduled by DELETE /user/{id}. If user data is not yet deleted then the account is fully recovered, except any email addresses that might have been already recycled

parameters.description: Partial match of a forward email address or URL

post.description: Add a new email address for a User. Addresses can contain unicode characters. Dots in usernames are normalized so no need to create both "firstlast@example.com" and "first.last@example.com" Special addresses `*@example.com`, `*suffix@example.com` and `username@*` catches all emails to these domains or users without a registered destination (requires allowWildcard argument)

main.description: Indicates if this is the default address for the User

allowWildcard.description: If true then address value can be in the form of `*@example.com`, `*suffix@example.com` and `username@*`, otherwise using * is not allowed. Static suffix can be up to 32 characters long.

tags.description: A list of tags associated with this address

metaData.description: Optional metadata, must be an object or JSON formatted string

internalData.description: Optional metadata for internal use, must be an object or JSON formatted string of an object. Not available for user-role tokens

get.summary: List registered Addresses for a User

parameters.description: If true, then includes metaData in the response

tags.description: List of tags associated with the Address

internalData.description: Internal metadata object (if available), not included for user-role requests

address.description: New address if you want to rename existing address. Only affects normal addresses, special addresses that include * can not be changed

parameters.description: If true then resolves also wildcard addresses

put.description: Renames domain names for addresses, DKIM keys and Domain Aliases

parameters.name: specialUse
parameters.description: Should the response include only folders with specialUse flag set.

parameters.name: showHidden
parameters.description: Hidden folders are not included in the listing by default.

parameters.name: counters
parameters.description: Should the response include counters (total + unseen). Counters come with some overhead.

parameters.name: sizes
parameters.description: Should the response include mailbox size in bytes. Size numbers come with a lot of overhead as an aggregated query is ran.

path.description: Full path of the mailbox, folders are separated by slashes, ends with the mailbox name (unicode string)

specialUse.description: Either special use identifier or null. One of Drafts, Junk, Sent or Trash

modifyIndex.description: Modification sequence number. Incremented on every change in the mailbox.

subscribed.description: Mailbox subscription status. IMAP clients may unsubscribe from a folder.

retention.description: Default retention policy for this mailbox (in ms). If set then messages added to this maibox will be automatically deleted after retention time.

hidden.description: Is the folder hidden or not

total.description: How many messages are stored in this mailbox

unseen.description: How many unseen messages are stored in this mailbox

size.description: Total size of mailbox in bytes.

path.description: Full path of the mailbox, folders are separated by slashes, ends with the mailbox name (unicode string)

hidden.description: Is the folder hidden or not. Hidden folders can not be opened in IMAP.

retention.description: Retention policy for the created Mailbox. Milliseconds after a message added to mailbox expires. Set to 0 to disable.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: If mailbox is specified as `resolve` in the path then use this param as mailbox path instead of the given mailbox id.

path.description: Full path of the mailbox, folders are separated by slashes, ends with the mailbox name (unicode string)

specialUse.description: Either special use identifier or null. One of Drafts, Junk, Sent or Trash

modifyIndex.description: Modification sequence number. Incremented on every change in the mailbox.

subscribed.description: Mailbox subscription status. IMAP clients may unsubscribe from a folder.

hidden.description: Is the folder hidden or not

total.description: How many messages are stored in this mailbox

unseen.description: How many unseen messages are stored in this mailbox

path.description: Full path of the mailbox, use this to rename an existing Mailbox

retention.description: Retention policy for the Mailbox (in ms). Changing retention value only affects messages added to this folder after the change

hidden.description: Is the folder hidden or not. Hidden folders can not be opened in IMAP.

get.description: Lists all messages in a mailbox

parameters.name: unseen
parameters.description: If true, then returns only unseen messages

parameters.name: metaData
parameters.description: If true, then includes metaData in the response

parameters.name: threadCounters
parameters.description: If true, then includes threadMessageCount in the response. Counters come with some overhead

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Ordering of the records by insert date

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Cursor value for next page, retrieved from nextCursor response value

parameters.name: previous
parameters.description: Cursor value for previous page, retrieved from previousCursor response value

parameters.name: includeHeaders
parameters.description: Comma separated list of header keys to include in the response

previousCursor.description: Either a cursor string or false if there are not any previous results

nextCursor.description: Either a cursor string or false if there are not any next results

put.description: This method updates message flags and also allows to move messages to a different mailbox

message.description: Message ID. Either singular or comma separated number (1,2,3) or colon separated range (3:15), or a range from UID to end (3:*)

moveTo.description: ID of the target Mailbox if you want to move messages

expires.description: Either expiration date or false to turn off autoexpiration

metaData.description: Optional metadata, must be an object or JSON formatted string

id.description: If messages were moved then lists new ID values. Array entry is an array with first element pointing to old ID and second to new ID

updated.description: If messages were not moved, then indicates the number of updated messages

delete.summary: Delete all Messages from a Mailbox

deleted.description: Indicates the count of deleted messages

errors.description: Indicate the count of errors during the delete

post.description: This method allows to upload either an RFC822 formatted message or a message structure to a mailbox. Raw message is stored unmodified, no headers are added or removed. If you want to generate the uploaded message from structured data fields, then do not use the raw property.

unseen.description: Is the message unseen or not

flagged.description: Is the message flagged or not

draft.description: Is the message a draft or not

raw.description: base64 encoded message source. Alternatively, you can provide this value as POST body by using message/rfc822 MIME type. If raw message is provided then it overrides any other mail configuration

headers.description: Custom headers for the message. If reference message is set then In-Reply-To and References headers are set automatically

subject.description: Message subject. If not then resolved from Reference message

files.description: Attachments as storage file IDs. NB! When retrieving message info then an array of objects is returned. When uploading a message then an array of IDs is used.

metaData.description: Optional metadata, must be an object or JSON formatted string

replacePrevious.description: If set, then deletes a previous message when storing the new one. Useful when uploading a new Draft message.

malbox.description: Mailbox ID the message was stored into

size.description: Size of the RFC822 formatted email

previousDeleted.description: Set if replacing a previous message was requested

get.description: This method allows searching for matching messages.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Message ID values, only applies when used in combination with `mailbox`. Either comma separated numbers (1,2,3) or colon separated range (3:15), or a range from UID to end (3:*)

parameters.name: or
parameters.description: At least onOne of the included terms must match

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search string, uses MongoDB fulltext index. Covers data from mesage body and also common headers like from, to, subject etc.

parameters.name: datestart
parameters.description: Datestring for the earliest message storing time

parameters.name: dateend
parameters.description: Datestring for the latest message storing time

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Partial match for the From: header line

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Partial match for the To: and Cc: header lines

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Partial match for the Subject: header line

parameters.name: attachments
parameters.description: If true, then matches only messages with attachments

parameters.name: flagged
parameters.description: If true, then matches only messages with \Flagged flags

parameters.name: unseen
parameters.description: If true, then matches only messages without \Seen flags

parameters.name: includeHeaders
parameters.description: Comma separated list of header keys to include in the response

parameters.name: searchable
parameters.description: If true, then matches messages not in Junk or Trash

parameters.name: threadCounters
parameters.description: If true, then includes threadMessageCount in the response. Counters come with some overhead

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Ordering of the records by insert date. If no order is supplied, results are sorted by heir mongoDB ObjectId.

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Cursor value for next page, retrieved from nextCursor response value

parameters.name: previous
parameters.description: Cursor value for previous page, retrieved from previousCursor response value

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Current page number. Informational only, page numbers start from 1

previousCursor.description: Either a cursor string or false if there are not any previous results

nextCursor.description: Either a cursor string or false if there are not any next results

post.description: This method allows applying an action to all matching messages. This is an async method so that it will return immediately. Actual modifications are run in the background.

id.description: Message ID values, only applies when used in combination with `mailbox`. Either comma separated numbers (1,2,3) or colon separated range (3:15), or a range from UID to end (3:*)

or.description: At least onOne of the included terms must match

query.description: Search string, uses MongoDB fulltext index. Covers data from mesage body and also common headers like from, to, subject etc.

from.description: Partial match for the From: header line

to.description: Partial match for the To: and Cc: header lines

subject.description: Partial match for the Subject: header line

query.description: Search string, uses MongoDB fulltext index. Covers data from mesage body and also common headers like from, to, subject etc.

datestart.description: Datestring for the earliest message storing time

dateend.description: Datestring for the latest message storing time

from.description: Partial match for the From: header line

to.description: Partial match for the To: and Cc: header lines

subject.description: Partial match for the Subject: header line

attachments.description: If true, then matches only messages with attachments

flagged.description: If true, then matches only messages with \Flagged flags

unseen.description: If true, then matches only messages without \Seen flags

includeHeaders.description: Comma separated list of header keys to include in the response

searchable.description: If true, then matches messages not in Junk or Trash

action.description: Define actions to take with matching messages

moveTo.description: ID of the target Mailbox if you want to move messages

success.description: Indicates if the action succeeded or not

existing.description: Indicates if the scheduled operation already exists

parameters.name: replaceCidLinks
parameters.description: If true then replaces cid links

parameters.name: markAsSeen
parameters.description: If true then marks message as seen

expires.description: Datestring, if set then indicates the time after this message is automatically deleted

seen.description: Does this message have a \Seen flag

deleted.description: Does this message have a \Deleted flag

flagged.description: Does this message have a \Flagged flag

draft.description: Does this message have a \Draft flag

html.description: An array of HTML string. Every array element is from a separate mime node, usually you would just join these to a single string

hash.description: SHA-256 hash of the contents of the attachment

transferEncoding.description: Which transfer encoding was used (actual content when fetching attachments is not encoded)

related.description: Was this attachment found from a multipart/related node. This usually means that this is an embedded image

sizeKb.description: Approximate size of the attachment in kilobytes

verificationResults.description: Security verification info if message was received from MX. If this property is missing then do not automatically assume invalid TLS, SPF or DKIM.

spf.description: Domain name (either MFROM or HELO) of verified SPF or false if no SPF match was found

dkim.description: Domain name of verified DKIM signature or false if no valid signature was found

bimi.description: BIMI logo info. If logo validation failed in any way, then this property is not set

certified.description: If true, then this logo is from a VMC file

url.description: URL of the resource the logo was retrieved from

image.description: Data URL for the SVG image

contentType.description: Parsed Content-Type header. Usually needed to identify encrypted messages and such

value.description: MIME type of the message, eg. "multipart/mixed

params.description: An object with Content-Type params as key-value pairs

metaData.description: Custom metadata object set for this message

files.description: List of files added to this message as attachments. Applies to Drafts, normal messages do not have this property. Needed to prevent uploading the same attachment every time a draft is updated

put.summary: Update message information with path param
put.description: This method updates message flags and also allows to move messages to a different mailbox

moveTo.description: ID of the target Mailbox if you want to move messages

expires.description: Either expiration date or false to turn off autoexpiration

id.description: If messages were moved then lists new ID values. Array entry is an array with first element pointing to old ID and second to new ID

updated.description: If messages were not moved, then indicates the number of updated messages

get.description: This method returns the full RFC822 formatted source of the stored message
This method returns attachment file contents in binary form

parameters.name: sendAsString
parameters.description: If true then sends the original attachment back in string format with correct encoding.

post.description: This method allows either to re-forward a message to an original forward target or forward it to some other address. This is useful if a user had forwarding turned on but the message was not delivered so you can try again. Forwarding does not modify the original message.

addresses.description: An array of additional forward targets

post.description: This method allows to submit a draft message for delivery. Draft is moved to Sent mail folder.

deleteFiles.description: If true then deletes attachment files listed in metaData.files array

sendTime.description: Datestring for delivery if message should be sent some later time

delete.description: You can delete outbound emails that are still in queue. Queue ID can be found from the `outbound` property of a stored email.

parameters.name: queueId
parameters.description: Outbound queue ID of the message

post.description: If an email is sent from a domain that is listed in the allowlist then it is never marked as spam. Lists apply for tagged users.

domain.description: Domain name to allowlist for users/addresses that include this tag

post.description: If an email is sent from a domain that is listed in the blocklist then it is always marked as spam. Lists apply for tagged users.

domain.description: Domain name to blocklist for users/addresses that include this tag

parameters.name: showAll
parameters.description: If not true then skips entries with a TTL set

description.description: Description for the Application Password entry

scopes.description: List of scopes this Password applies to. Special scope "*" indicates that this password can be used for any scope except "master"

address.description: E-mail address to be used as the account address in mobileconfig file. Must be one of the listed identity addresses of the user. Defaults to the main address of the user

password.description: Optional pregenerated password. Must be 16 characters, latin letters only.

generateMobileconfig.description: If true then result contains a mobileconfig formatted file with account config

ttl.description: TTL in seconds for this password. Every time password is used, TTL is reset to this value

password.description: Application Specific Password. Generated password is whitespace agnostic, so it could be displayed to the client as "abcd efgh ijkl mnop" instead of "abcdefghijklmnop"

mobileconfig.description: Base64 encoded mobileconfig file. Generated profile file should be sent to the client with Content-Type value of application/x-apple-aspen-config.

address.description: Account address or the address specified in params of this endpoint

scopes.description: Allowed scopes for the Application Password

expires.description: Application password expires after the given date

post.description: This method generates TOTP seed and QR code for 2FA. User needs to verify the seed value using 2fa/totp/enable endpoint

label.description: Label text for QR code (defaults to username)

issuer.description: Description text for QR code (defaults to "WildDuck")

post.description: This method enables TOTP for a user by verifying the seed value generated from 2fa/totp/setup

token.description: 6-digit number that matches seed value from 2fa/totp/setup

delete.description: This method disables TOTP for a user. Does not affect other 2FA mechanisms a user might have set up

post.description: This method checks if a TOTP token provided by a User is valid for authentication

delete.description: This method disables all 2FA mechanisms a user might have set up

put.description: This method disables account password for IMAP/POP3/SMTP

delete.description: This method disables custom 2FA. If it was the only 2FA set up, then account password for IMAP/POP3/SMTP gets enabled again

get.description: This method returns the list of WebAuthN credentials for a given user

rawId.description: Raw ID string of the credential in hex

authenticatorAttachment.description: Indicates whether authenticators is a part of the OS ("platform"), or roaming authenticators ("cross-platform")

deleted.description: Specifies whether the given credential has been deleted

icon.description: Rp icon. data/image string in base64 format

transports.description: Credential transports. If authenticatorAttachment is "platform" then ["internal"] otherwise ["usb", "nfc", "ble"]

post.description: Attestation is used to verify the authenticity of the authenticator and provide assurances about its features.

clientDataJSON.description: Clientside data JSON as hex string

attestationObject.description: Attestation object represented as a hex string

rawId.description: Credential RawID as a hex string

challenge.description: Challenge of the credential as hex string

clientDataJSON.description: Client data JSON as hex string

signature.description: Private key encrypted signature to verify with public key on the server. Hex string

token.description: If true response will contain the user auth token

get.description: This api call returns an EventSource response. Listen on this stream to get notifications about changes in messages and mailboxes. Returned events are JSON encoded strings

scope.description: Required scope. One of master, imap, smtp, pop3

Required scope. One of master, imap, smtp, pop3

appId.description: Optional appId which is the URL of the app

token.description: If true then generates a temporary access token that is valid for this user. Only available if scope is "master". When using user tokens then you can replace user ID in URLs with "me".

scope.description: The scope this authentication is valid for

requirePasswordChange.description: Indicates if account hassword has been reset and should be replaced

token.description: If access token was requested then this is the value to use as access token when making API requests on behalf of logged in user.

delete.description: This method invalidates currently used authentication token. If token is not provided then nothing happens

post.summary: Create or update TLS certificate for server name
post.description:
Add a new TLS certificate for a server name or update existing one. You can add a single certificate for each server name but SAN names are supported as well. For example you can add a sertificate for "mydomain.com" that includes "*.mydomain.com" in SAN and the same certificate would be used for requests that do not have it's own server name registered but match the SAN value.
> NB! you must ensure yourself that the `servername` value is actually listed in certificate's common name or SAN as WildDuck is going to use this certificate regardless.

servername.description: Server name this TLS certificate applies to

privateKey.description: PEM formatted TLS private key. Optional if certificate is managed by ACME

cert.description: PEM formatted TLS certificate or a certificate bundle with concatenated certificate and CA chain. Optional if certificate is managed by ACME

ca.description: CA chain certificates. Not needed if `cert` value is a bundle

acme.description: If true then private key and certificate are managed automatically by ACME

servername.description: The server name this certificate applies to

altNames.description: SAN servernames listed in the certificate

acme.description: If true then private key and certificate are managed automatically by ACME

id.description: Unique ID of the cert (24 byte hex)

autogenerated.description: Was the certificate automatically generated on SNI request

altNames.description: SAN servernames listed in the certificate

acme.description: If true then private key and certificate are managed automatically by ACME

hasCert.description: True if certificate actually has the certificate or private key

message.description: Error message specifying what went wrong

allowed.description: Allowed quota of the user in bytes

address.description: Main email address of the User

tags.description: List of tags associated with the User

autoreply.description: Is autoreply enabled or not (start time may still be in the future or end time in the past)

encryptMessages.description: If true then received messages are encrypted

encryptForwarded.description: If true then forwarded messages are encrypted

internalData.description: Custom metadata value for internal use. Included if internalData query argument was true and request was not made using user-role token

hasPasswordSet.description: If true then the User has a password set and can authenticate

disabled.description: If true then user can not authenticate or receive any new mail

suspended.description: If true then user can not authenticate

KeyInfo.description: Information about public key or false if key is not available

address.description: E-mail address listed in public key

allowed.description: How many messages per 24 hours can be send

used.description: How many messages are sent during current 24 hour period

ttl.description: Time until the end of current 24 hour period

used.description: How many filters have been created

allowed.description: How many messages per 24 hours can be forwarded

used.description: How many messages are forwarded during current 24 hour period

ttl.description: Time until the end of current 24 hour period

allowed.description: How many messages per 1 hour can be received

used.description: How many messages are received during current 1 hour period

ttl.description: Time until the end of current 1 hour period

allowed.description: How many bytes per 24 hours can be uploaded via IMAP. Only message contents are counted, not protocol overhead.

used.description: How many bytes are uploaded during current 24 hour period

ttl.description: Time until the end of current 24 hour period

allowed.description: How many parallel IMAP connections are permitted

used.description: How many parallel IMAP connections are currenlty in use

user.description: User ID this address belongs to if this is a User address

forwarded.description: If true then it is a forwarded address

forwardedDisabled.description: If true then the forwarded address is disabled

tags.description: List of tags associated with the Address

metaData.description: Metadata object (if available)

internalData.description: Internal metadata object (if available), not included for user-role requests

main.description: Indicates if this is the default address for the User

created.description: Datestring of the time the address was created

tags.description: List of tags associated with the Address

metaData.description: Metadata object (if available)

status.description: If true, then autoreply is enabled for this address

start.description: Either a date string or boolean false to disable start time checks

end.description: Either a date string or boolean false to disable end time checks

name.description: Name that is used for the From: header in autoreply message

status.description: If true, then autoreply is enabled for this address

name.description: Name that is used for the From: header in autoreply message

attachments.description: If true, then includes all attachments from the original message. If it is an array of attachment ID's includes attachments from the list

Bimi.description: Marks BIMI verification as passed for a domain. NB! BIMI record and logo files for the domain must be valid.

domain.description: Domain name for the BIMI record. It does not have to be the same as the From address.

ContentType.description: Parsed Content-Type header. Usually needed to identify encrypted messages and such

value.description: MIME type of the message, eg. "multipart/mixed"

params.description: An object with Content-Type params as key-value pairs

threadMessageCount.description: Amount of messages in the Thread. Included if threadCounters query argument was true

bcc.description: Recipients in Bcc: field. Usually only available for drafts

seen.description: Is this message alread seen or not

deleted.description: Does this message have a Deleted flag (should not have as messages are automatically deleted once this flag is set)

flagged.description: Does this message have a Flagged flag

answered.description: Does this message have a Answered flag

forwarded.description: Does this message have a $Forwarded flag

encrypted.description: Specifies whether the message is encrypted

metaData.description: Custom metadata value. Included if metaData query argument was true

headers.description: Header object keys requested with the includeHeaders argument

contentType.description: MIME type for the attachment file

encoding.description: Encoding to use to store the attachments

cid.description: Content-ID value if you want to reference to this attachment from HTML formatted message

value.description: RCPT TO address as provided by SMTP client

rcpt.description: Array of addresses from RCPT TO (should have just one normally)

List.description: If set then this message is from a mailing list

Tls.description: TLS information. Value is false if TLS was not used

mailbox.description: Mailbox ID the message was stored into

size.description: Size of the RFC822 formatted email

contentType.description: Content-Type of the file. False if none

created.description: Datestring of the time the filter was created

disabled.description: If true, then this filter is ignored

metaData.description: Custom metadata value. Included if metaData query argument was true

created.description: Datestring of the time the filter was created

disabled.description: If true, then this filter is ignored

metaData.description: Custom metadata value. Included if metaData query argument was true

Query.description: Rules that a message must match

from.description: Partial match for the From: header (case insensitive)

to.description: Partial match for the To:/Cc: headers (case insensitive)

subject.description: Partial match for the Subject: header (case insensitive)

listId.description: Partial match for the List-ID: header (case insensitive)

ha.description: Does a message have to have an attachment or not

size.description: Message size in bytes. If the value is a positive number then message needs to be larger, if negative then message needs to be smaller than abs(size) value

Action.description: Action to take with a matching message

seen.description: If true then mark matching messages as Seen

flag.description: If true then mark matching messages as Flagged

delete.description: If true then do not store matching messages

spam.description: If true then store matching messags to Junk Mail folder

mailbox.description: Mailbox ID to store matching messages to

targets.description: An array of forwarding targets. The value could either be an email address or a relay url to next MX server ("smtp://mx2.zone.eu:25") or an URL where mail contents are POSTed to

time.description: Datestring of last use or false if password has not been used

event.description: Event ID of the security log for the last authentication

scopes.description: Allowed scopes for the Application Password

expires.description: Application password expires after the given date

protocol.description: Protocol that the authentication was made from

last.description: Date of the last update of data

events.description: Number of times same auth log has accured

source.description: Source of auth. Example: `master` if password auth was used

expires.description: After this date the given auth log document will not be updated and instead a new one will be created

Reference.description: Optional referenced email. If uploaded message is a reply draft and relevant fields are not provided then these are resolved from the message to be replied to

mailbox.description: Mailbox ID the message was stored to

domain.description: The domain this alias applies to
The domain this DKIM key applies to

name.description: Is the domain name of TXT

servername.description: The server name this certificate applies to

acme.description: If true then private key and certificate are managed automatically by ACME

autogenerated.description: Was the certificate automatically generated on SNI request

altNames.description: SAN servernames listed in the certificate

type.description: An array of event types this webhook matches

custom.description: If true then the value is set
